p.s: Sonnet 116 by William Shakespeare was published in the collection with others in 1609.
Sonnet 116 is placed in the sequence that is adressedaddressed to or concerns a young man.
He is loved by the speaker but the society doesn't support this relationship so it must stay a secret.
The first quatrain says there are two ways to experience love.
One time does not forever and can change or disappear.
The speaker thinks the other kind of love that is constant and true is difficult to reach and rear and he only wants this love.
The second quatrain is about the features and signs of this true love.
It is great and like a landmark always there and unbreakable.
In the third quatrain, the speaker says that the true love can survive the death, even if the loved one is not living anymore.
Also times of seperationseparation only cause this love to grow and become stronger.

In the final couplet, the speaker confirms he has the experience of true love with a young man and states if he is not right with this thesis, the sonnet and his other writings would tell lies and true love has never exist.
The topic of this sonnet is the difference between two ways of loving someone.
The speaker thinks the second way, the true love, is beautiful and the highest thing or feeling humans can reach.
